args: Well, if it isn't my favorite customer!\nWhat can I do you for today?
Some dragonfruit and holy water, please.\nOh, and then...
Thanks for waiting! This is everything\nyou ordered, right?
Looks good. Thanks as always, Nina.
The thanks are all mine. I'm so grateful\nto have a regular customer like you!
Well, your store carries everything,\nand the quality is all top-shelf.
We've been able to keep up the long fight\nbecause we have you in our corner.
I'm honored that I could have been of\nservice—and I've heard hundreds of\nstories about all the great work you do!
I even hear you've been out to North\nGrastaea lately? What's it like up there?
Well, it's different from here in a lot of\nways, but Grams is definitely quite a deal.
The gorgeous cityscape is overwhelming,\nof course, but the culture and values of the\npeople are what really make it special.
Er, what do you mean by\n＂culture and values＂?

Well, the Ilian Church has an extremely
strong presence there, to the point where
it's involved with both politics and the
people's daily lives.

Er, or that's how it USED to be, anyway.
The city was basically leveled a little
while ago when Satan... Well, it's a
long story—and a sad one too.
Ah, right. That must be all the chatter I\nkeep hearing about our taking in refugees\nhere in Alberia.
Yeah, I'm glad that worked out, because\nfiends have been going berserk all over\nNorth Grastaea ever since the city fell.
I guess that means it's dangerous for\npeople to travel to the north, huh?
Yeah. It's been rough stuff, and I suspect\nit's only going to become an even fiercer\nbattle moving forward.

We've got people staying to protect the
Halidom and other people making the
expeditions to the north, so we're
stretched thin when it comes to fighters.
Bwa ha ha ha! This here must be the\nNina Shop what we keep hearin' about!
Hooo-eee! We're gonna make us\nsome serious coin in this joint!
Ah, customers. Sorry, but we'll have to\nreturn to this once they're done.
Welcome, gents! What can I do you for?
We, uh...got somethin' we need.\nThink ya can do that?
Getting people what they need is our\nbread and butter! So what is it?
Don't move a muscle, you straw-haired\npuke, unless ya want yer next purchase\nto be a coffin for the shopmiss here!
Now make with the cash, little lady,\nand do it snappy!
The hell did ya just say?!
The Nina Shop has a longstanding policy\nof greeting all customers with a smile...\nwith three exceptions.
Customers with unreasonable complaints,\ncustomers who shoplift...and customers\nwho try to rob me!

I'm not giving you people anything!
Not a single thing on the shelves, and not
one single rupie—so you can make like a
lousy scout and get lost!
Lady, have you EVER heard of a bandit\nwhat just up and agrees to vamoose the\nmoment someone says boo to 'im?
But gentlemen, there are two ways\nyou can leave this store: on your feet...\nOR ON YOUR STUPID BUTTS!
Uh, Nina?! I don't think these are the\nkind of guys you want to mess with!
Oh it's fine. I can fight now.\nI have the power of...
I had no idea you knew magic, Nina—\nand such powerful magic to boot!
Uh, but what is ＂rupie magic,＂ exactly?

Why, I'm glad you asked! Rupie magic is a
legendary form of magic that awakens in
those merchants who have made lots and
lots and LOTS of the ol' cashola!
We can draw out the power hiding\nin rupies and use it as magic!

Think about it! Every time something is
bought or sold, rupies change hands.
Before you know it, they've traveled all
over the whole darn world!

And mana—the source of magic—ALSO
travels around the world. You could say
the fundamental nature of rupies and
mana is the same!
Uh...I hear the words you're saying,\nbut I'm having trouble making sense\nof them in that particular order.
Anyway, I can fight now is the point.
As such, you have to let me join you guys!
You want to join us? Like, JOIN join us?
Yeah! That's actually what I was going to\ntalk to you about right before those two\nbooger-faces walked in here.
I've always been really interested\nin North Grastaea.

See, I inherited the shop from my dad,
which made me a business owner at a
pretty early age. But as a result, I haven't
had many chances to really travel.

And I'd bet rupies to donuts that if I had
more chances to go to new places I don't
know much about, I could grow as
a merchant!

Plus, I think my rupie magic would make
me a real asset in your pocketbook, so to
speak. So if you're heading north soon,
I'd like you to take me with you!
Well, this isn't the conversation I was\nexpecting to have today, but I can't deny\nthat your rupie magic has a real kick.
Still, why are you so keen on heading to\nNorth Grastaea? Surely there are less-\ndangerous places you could visit?

Because, uh...I want to test my skill!
And if I can fight in a dangerous place,
I'll know I can safely do business myself
going forward.
In that case, the next time we go north,\nI'll be sure to let you know.
Oh, just {player_name} is fine.\nWe're comrades-in-arms now, after all.
Bit of a leap to go from ＂my favorite\ncustomer＂ to ＂prince＂ to just a name,\nbut if that's what you want, I'll try!
That's all I ask. It'll be great to have you\nfighting alongside us, Nina. Thank you!
I'll be sure to prove how helpful\nI can be as one of your comrades!
